title: Inside Google's quantum lab as it claims a historic computing breakthrough
text:
At first sight, the future of computing looks more like an movie villain's superweapon than the history-making machine Google claims. Suspended from a steel platform, layers of gold-plated copper conductors and intricately threaded pipes are arranged. It is only the small microchip, buried towards the bottom of it all, that betrays the fact that this is a computer.

The quantum computer - named Sycamore - at Google’s laboratory in Santa Barbara is like no computer most of us are used to. Nor does it bear any resemblance to today’s high-powered supercomputers, which are used to predict weather patterns and run artificial intelligence programs. But the company claims that it can do something no...
description: At first sight, the future of computing looks more like an movie villain's superweapon than the history-making machine Google claims.
